title: Stop saying Riot is doing things for and around professional play
body: When professionals hate what they are doing.

replies.body: Everyone knows riot doesn't actually try to balance this game.
why else would they buff lee tho

> In patch 8.4, we pushed the activation time of Stopwatch to 10 minutes because its prevalence in professional play was delaying or inhibiting early action. In 8.10 we tried a lower value (8 minutes), but we've begun observing the same impact on pro play, so we're reverting those changes.

This is definitive proof that Riot balances the game around pro play.

> [{quoted}](name=Ok sure but why,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j9fUyemR,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-08-08T15:32:46.001+0000)
>
> By "Professional play," they mean, "Esports." The professional players have no say in what they think will "look cool."

Meanwhile they are leaving because they hate the damage. Scaring away professionals isnt doing it for them.
How is that a contradiction? You can do something that you believe is for the good of another person, and that person can still hate it. Case and point: feeding vegetables to a picky eater.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j9fUyemR,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-08-08T15:27:14.814+0000)

> How is that a contradiction? You can do something that you believe is for the good of another person, and that person can still hate it. Case and point: feeding vegetables to a picky eater.

The very thing you claim they are doing is the very thing scaring away professionals.

Trying to feed vegetables to a kid can scare them away too.

I'm not saying the game is in a good state (it's not), but just because Pros hate a change doesn't mean the change wasn't designed around the Pros in the first place.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j9fUyemR,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-08-08T16:20:05.897+0000)

> 
> I'm not saying the game is in a good state (it's not), but just because Pros hate a change doesn't mean the change wasn't designed around the Pros in the first place.

You have the wrong analogy. Feeding poison to kids and saying it's for the kids doesn't mean it is actually for the kids.
What the professionals do and don't like isn't what's important; it's what the spectators like that's important.
